job_title: RN Case Manager in Bristol, CT
pros: Caring and compassionate leadership fall the way to the top
cons: RNs are all overwhelmed no matter where you work

pros: Community feel, autonomy, transparency, leadership is actively involved with all aspects of the healthcare system
cons: Currently no matching 403b, no employer paid std only CT leave, pay scale not as progressive as other larger health care systems in the state.

pros: Worked with great staff nurses
cons: Hired a director with way less qualifications than me. Staff nurses allowed to bully nurse managers. Magnet hospital but always the same nurses on committees never allow other nurses the chance.

pros: Flexible schedule(ish) that just comes with the nursing field
cons: low pay, poor management, insane ratios, and shady management. outdated tech, broken equipment.

job_title: Patient Service Representative in Bristol, CT
pros: It was a convenient location from home.
cons: My supervisor was all over the place and could not train properly. Cattiness amongst senior representatives. They talked about patients behind their backs.

job_title: Patient Financial Counselor in Bristol, CT
pros: Experience working in the field.
cons: Management needs an immediate overhaul.

review_title: Not great pay, but okay customer service
pros: The people are warm and kind
cons: The pay rate varies. For example, working an overnight shift, you may have 2-3 different rates based on what times you work.

pros: Fair, team driven, resourceful, management cares, you have a voice
cons: do not have anything bad to say!

pros: There are employees who want to do the right thing
cons:
Negative $30million in revenue
Cant afford quality staff or medical equipment 
Extensive turnover (CFOs do not last longer than a few years).
CEO needs to go, he has no clue how to treat employees or how to run a financially stable organization.   He uses the hospital as his own personal spending playground.

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Hartford, CT
pros: Smaller hospital so you get to know your co workers quickly.
cons: Staffing issues, can be disorganized.

job_title: Sterile Processing Technician in Hartford, CT
pros: Small hospital. Can be used as a first experience for a better position in another hospital.
cons: Lack of strong leadership. Toxic work environment. Work load is always high. Lack of modern technology to help with training and making work flow more efficient. Everything is done on paper. Rate of pay is the lowest.

pros: Some nice people I have met that are hard workers
cons: No consequences for those who cause conflict.

pros: Coworkers are great and nice to work with
cons: No work life balance, no room for improvement

job_title: Patient Care Associate in Bristol, CT
pros:
Excellent Patient care and Patient Focus.
Pay rate is adequate and hours are comfortable.
Detailed and organized Training.
cons:
Staff is not supportive specifically management.
***Cut-throat training environment.***
Management acts first and asks questions later. 
Management does not see the small picture, only the big picture. They should be able to see both.

review_title: Sad Place to work with little regard for employees
pros: Close to home, easy parking for offsite employees, tuition reimbursement.
cons: Raises non-existent, open door policy looks good on paper, but does not exist in reality. Benefit costs go up regularly but raises do not come anywhere near to what is lost in vacation/sick time,disability,or exorbitant co-pays. Employees are expected to work harder than ever for no raise or even a sincere thank you. Meanwhile, CEO's salary is published, causing terrible moral within hospital at the one sidedness of management.

review_title: Fast paced but great place to work
pros: Great Benefits, always busy... The staff was great to work with. The days passed very quickly and there was always a lunch or breakfast scheduled with a pharmaceutical rep, which meant never having to worry about packing meals.
cons: There was work overload at times and the hours changed too frequently.

pros: Very friendly associates, great in services to keep you up to date, excellent health coverage, great teaching hospital for residents, nursing students & other healthcare professional students,
cons: Lack of staff, lack of staff communication from time to time, lack of time off when needed, not enough sick time

pros: Great teamwork, patient centered care, high level of respect and trust
cons: Staffing is lean making it sometimes difficult to try new things or try out new ideas.

job_title: Patient Access Representative in Bristol, CT
pros: Not too overwhelmingly busy all the time.
cons: Dirty Facility, Arrogant and Unhelpful Doctors, Useless leadership, Terribly low pay. Miserable staff that will throw you under a bus real fast. I advise you to please stay away. No growth potential at all

pros: Committed team members, great staff retention and HR services
cons: They frozen and then cancelled their pension plan

pros: Nice supervisor and pleasant people in cafeteria
cons: very hard atmosphere to feel comfortable in
